title: Understanding Buffer Capacity
text: Buffer capacity is an important concept in analytical chemistry. It refers to the ability of a buffer solution to resist changes in pH when an acid or base is added.

title: Factors Affecting Buffer Capacity
text: The buffer capacity depends on the concentration of the acid and its conjugate base in the solution. Higher concentrations generally lead to a higher buffer capacity.

hintAnswer: A measure of how much strong acid or strong base a buffer can absorb before its pH changes significantly.
title: Identifying Buffer Capacity
text: Which of the following best describes buffer capacity?
choices: The exact pH of a buffer at any temperature.
A measure of how much strong acid or strong base a buffer can absorb before its pH changes significantly.
The solubility of the buffer components.
The ratio of conjugate base to weak acid only.
